etymology.description: semantic: 广(广) (guǎng, 'shelter') + phonetic: 大(大) (dà, 'big') = grand festivities under shelter -> celebrate
etymology.interpretation: The character 庆(慶) (qìng, 'celebrate') combines a sense of grandness and a place of gathering, suggesting a communal celebration, often under a roof.
etymology.simplification: 广(广) (guǎng, 'shelter') was retained, while a simplified component 大(大) (dà, 'big') maintained the phonetic element, focusing on the sense of a grand event.

examples.chinese: 我们庆祝朋友的生日(我們慶祝朋友的生日)。
每逢佳节时(每逢佳節時)，家家户户共庆团圆(家家戶戶共慶團圓)。
examples.pinyin: Měi féng jiājié shí, jiājiā hùhù gòng qìng tuányuán.
examples.english: Every festive season, every household celebrates reunion.

examples.chinese: 春风拂面时(春風拂面時)，大地复苏促人庆新生(大地復蘇促人慶新生)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnfēng fú miàn shí, dàdì fùsū cù rén qìng xīnshēng.
examples.english: When the spring breeze caresses the face, the revitalized earth prompts people to celebrate new life.
